375.question: What is MDCAT and who conducts it?
375.answer: A: MDCAT (Medical and Dental Colleges Admission Test) is a standardized paper-based exam conducted by the Pakistan Medical & Dental Council (PM&DC) to ensure a uniform admission process across all medical and dental institutions in Pakistan.

376.question: What is the format and duration of the MDCAT exam?
376.answer: A: The exam is a paper-based test consisting of 200 MCQs, and the total duration is 3.5 hours.

377.question: What are the passing criteria for MDCAT?
377.answer: A: A minimum of 65% marks is required for admission into Medical colleges and 55% for Dental colleges. There is no negative marking.

378.question: How are the questions distributed among subjects in MDCAT?
378.answer:
A: - Biology: 68 MCQs (34%)
- Chemistry: 54 MCQs (27%)
- Physics: 54 MCQs (27%)
- English: 18 MCQs (9%)
- Logical Reasoning: 6 MCQs (3%)

379.question: What is the difficulty level of the exam questions?
379.answer: A: 20% Easy, 60% Moderate, 20% Difficult. Also, 70% recall-based and 30% application-based in Biology, Chemistry, and Physics.

380.question: What are the key topics in Biology for MDCAT?
380.answer: A: Topics include Biodiversity, Bioenergetics, Biological Molecules, Cell Structure, Enzymes, Evolution, Reproduction, Genetics, and more.

381.question: Is Evolution part of the MDCAT syllabus?
381.answer: A: Yes, it includes concepts like Darwin’s theory, Lamarck’s theory, and evidence of evolution.

382.question: Are diagrams and cell organelles part of the MDCAT Biology?
382.answer: A: Yes, candidates must know structures and functions of nucleus, mitochondria, chloroplasts, and others.

383.question: Does MDCAT Chemistry include Organic Chemistry?
383.answer: A: Yes, topics include Hydrocarbons, Alkyl Halides, Alcohols, Phenols, Aldehydes, Ketones, and Macromolecules.

384.question: Is the periodic table and trends covered?
384.answer: A: Yes, the chemistry of S and P block elements, including trends in reactivity, atomic radii, and electronegativity, are included.

385.question: Are chemical reactions and equations included?
385.answer: A: Yes, stoichiometry, equilibrium, kinetics, thermochemistry, and electrochemistry are part of the curriculum.

386.question: What Physics topics are important for MDCAT?
386.answer: A: Key areas include Mechanics, Thermodynamics, Electrostatics, Current Electricity, Electromagnetism, and Nuclear Physics.

387.question: Is nuclear decay and half-life included?
387.answer: A: Yes, concepts of spontaneous decay, half-life, and biological effects of radiation are tested.

388.question: Do students need to memorize equations in Physics?
388.answer: A: Yes, understanding and applying standard equations for motion, energy, and electromagnetism is necessary.

389.question: What is the purpose of the English section in MDCAT?
389.answer: A: It assesses vocabulary, grammar, sentence structure, comprehension, and ability to understand academic-level English.

390.question: Will there be reading comprehension questions?
390.answer: A: Yes, students must read short passages and answer context-based questions.

391.question: Are grammar and sentence correction part of the test?
391.answer: A: Yes, it includes tenses, subject-verb agreement, articles, prepositions, punctuation, and sentence structure.

392.question: What is tested in the Logical Reasoning section?
392.answer: A: It includes Critical Thinking, Symbol Series, Logical Deductions, Problem Solving, Course of Action, and Cause & Effect analysis.

393.question: Are logic puzzles and sequences included?
393.answer: A: Yes, students may be asked to analyze letter/number patterns, family relations, or draw conclusions from given facts.

394.question: Is reasoning based on real-life scenarios part of the test?
394.answer: A: Yes, short real-life based arguments are given to evaluate decision-making and analytical thinking.

395.question: Who is eligible to apply for MBBS or BDS programs in Pakistan?
395.answer: A: A candidate must have passed the MDCAT, scored at least 60% in FSc/HSSC (or equivalent), and passed Biology and Chemistry. They may opt for either Physics or Mathematics as the third subject.

396.question: Are foreign or overseas Pakistani students required to take MDCAT?
396.answer: A: No. Foreign or overseas Pakistani students applying for reserved seats may appear in SAT-II (minimum 550 per subject) or foreign MCAT/UCAT with at least 50% marks in relevant subjects.

397.question: What are the official admission deadlines?
397.answer:
A: - Public Medical Colleges: December 31
- Private Medical Colleges: January 31
- Public Dental Colleges: February 15
- Private Dental Colleges: February 28

398.question: What is the merit calculation formula for admissions?

399.question: Can students apply to both medical and dental colleges?
399.answer: A: Yes, but they must submit separate applications for each. A student not applying for a specific program is not eligible for it.

400.question: How are merit lists and admissions finalized?
400.answer: A: Merit lists are published by the admitting university. At least three merit lists are displayed, and students must deposit fees within 3 working days. Failure to do so results in loss of admission rights.

401.question: What is the rule for vacant or unfilled seats?
401.answer: A: Vacant seats in public sector colleges can be filled only up to a date notified by the Council. After that, no admissions are allowed. Vacant private sector seats after admissions remain unfilled.

402.question: Can private colleges set their own fee and merit criteria?
402.answer: A: Yes, but they must follow the merit formula and publish fees transparently on their website. The maximum admission application fee is PKR 2,000.

403.question: When must private colleges publish their final merit list?
403.answer: A: By January 15 each year. It must be shared with both students and PM&DC.

404.question: What happens if a student accepts admission in two colleges?
404.answer: A: They must cancel the first admission in writing. If not, all admission offers become void, and the student becomes ineligible.

405.question: How is student registration handled?
405.answer: A: Students are registered with PM&DC after verification by the affiliating university. The CNIC becomes the official registration number.

406.question: What is the annual PM&DC student registration fee?
406.answer: A: It is notified each year and applies throughout the student's program. No refund is available if a student drops out or is expelled.

407.question: Can a student migrate from one college to another?
407.answer: A: Yes, but only after 2nd year MBBS or 1st year BDS. Migration must be merit-based if multiple applications are received for the same vacancy.

408.question: Is an NOC required for migration?
408.answer: A: No, colleges and universities cannot restrict a student’s right to transfer or demand a No Objection Certificate.

409.question: Who sets the curriculum for MBBS and BDS programs?
409.answer: A: The National Medical and Dental Academic Board formulates the curriculum, which must be followed strictly by all colleges.

410.question: Who conducts professional exams and declares results?
410.answer: A: Only the affiliating university can set, mark, and announce results for professional exams—not the colleges themselves.

411.question: Can a student retake a failed professional exam?
411.answer: A: Yes. Retakes are allowed as per university policy without additional tuition fees (though a small retake exam fee may apply).

412.question: Who is eligible for a house job?
412.answer: A: A student who has passed the final professional exam and completed the study program is eligible for provisional licensing and a house job.

413.question: Is it mandatory for hospitals to accept their own graduates for house jobs?
413.answer: A: Yes. A teaching hospital cannot refuse a house job to its own college graduate.

414.question: Are house officers in private hospitals entitled to stipends?
414.answer: A: Yes. Private hospitals must pay at least the same stipend as public hospitals in that province/territory.

415.question: Can I change my MDCAT center after registration in MDCAT 2024 re-take by sts ?
415.answer: A: No, you cannot change your MDCAT 2024 retake test center after registration. SIBA Testing Services (STS)

416.question: Will ID verification be conducted at the test center in MDCAT 2024?
416.answer: A: Yes, ID verification will be conducted at the test center for MDCAT 2024, Candidates must bring their original Admit Slip to the test center, along with one of the following original documents, which must be presented for verification: CNIC, Juvenile Card, Passport, Matriculation Marksheet, or Intermediate Marksheet. Entry will be denied without these.

417.question: Are mobile jammers used during test in MDCAT 2024 ?
417.answer:
A: Yes, SIBA Testing Services (STS), under Sukkur IBA University, implemented stringent security measures during the MDCAT 2024 retake, including the deployment of mobile jammers at examination centers to prevent cheating through electronic devices.?
In an official press release dated November 16, 2024, STS emphasized its commitment to conducting the MDCAT retake across all six divisions of Sindh with full transparency and merit. Therefore, while you can retake the MDCAT exam multiple times, each retake is subject to the policies and schedules set by the PMDC and the conducting bodies. It's advisable to stay updated with official announcements for any future retake opportunities.

419.question: What is the eligibility criteria for MDCAT ?
419.answer:

Minimum Marks: A minimum of 60% marks in the HSSC or equivalent examination is required.
Mandatory Subjects: Candidates must have passed the subjects of Biology and Chemistry. Additionally, they should have studied either Physics or Mathematics

426.question: What measures are taken against cheating in MDCAT 2024 ?
426.answer:
A: To uphold the integrity of MDCAT-2024, the Pakistan Medical and Dental Council (PMDC) and SIBA Testing Services (STS) put in place a multi-layered anti-cheating framework:
	Legal safeguards
o	Section 144 enforcement around all exam centres (no public gatherings or use of electronic devices within a 500 m radius) to deter outside assistance and proxy candidates 
o	Mobile-service suspension for the duration of the test window in key regions (e.g. Peshawar, Punjab), coordinated with PTA, to block calls/data that might facilitate cheating.
	Technical counter-measures
o	Signal jammers installed inside examination halls to prevent Bluetooth- or Wi-Fi-based earpieces and other wireless transmissions.
o	CCTV surveillance at every centre, recording all candidate activity for real-time monitoring and later audit.
o	Biometric identification (fingerprint/face scan) at entry, ensuring that only the registered candidate takes the test.
o	Tamper-proof question-paper handling, with serialized, sealed packets under strict chain-of-custody until distribution.
	Administrative oversight
o	Apex & supervisory committees formed by STS to oversee end-to-end test conduct under strict vigilance, from centre setup to result publication.
o	Multiple invigilators and monitoring teams per halleach centre staffed with a chief supervisor, supervisors, invigilators, and monitorsto enforce seating plans, conduct ID/body searches, and patrol exam rooms.
	On-site security
o	Police and security personnel posted at centre entrances to intercept any unauthorised materials or individuals and to respond immediately to incidents.
o	Strict item bans: candidates barred from carrying mobile phones, smartwatches, calculators, notes, bags, etc.; prohibited items are collected at entry.
	Punitive actions
o	Immediate disqualification & legal action against anyone caught with cheating devices (e.g., Bluetooth earpieces), including on-the-spot arrests and debarment from future exams.
o	Prosecution under anti-cheating/forgery laws, as outlined by PMDC, for facilitators or repeat offenders.
Combined, these legal, technical, administrative, and punitive layers aim to deliver a fully transparent, merit-based MDCAT-2024 for all candidates.

Sindh (STS) Paper

440.question: Is the MDCAT 2024 paper leak news true in MDCAT 2024 ?
